page.title: 03CHARLTON VILLAGE
page.content: CHARLTON IS AN OLD MINING VILLAGE, TAKING ITS NAME FROM THE MINE OWNERS. IT IS LOCATED TO THE EAST OF THE MINE AND COMPRISES TWO ROWS OF TERRACED HOUSES AND A FARMHOUSE. THERE IS, A SMALL SHOP WHICH IS A GENERAL DEALERS AND POST OFFICE, AND A COMMUNITY CENTRE. A METHODIST CHAPEL ORIGINALLY BUILT IN 1873 WITH A RELAYED STONE DATED 1961 COMMEMORATING ITS MODERNIZATION, IT IS SERVED BY A TRAVELLING MINISTER. THE ARTERIAL ROAD WHICH CONNECTS MARGROVE PARK WITH SLAPEWATH HAS BYPASSED CHARLTON TO THE NORTH. A WOOD RISES TO THE WEST OBSCURING THE OLD MINE WORKINGS AND OTHERWISE THE VILLAGE IS SURROUNDED BY OPEN AGRICULTURAL LAND. THE FRONT ROW OF HOUSES FACE NORTH EAST, LOOKING ONTO A GRASSED PLAY AREA WHICH LIES BETWEEN THEM AND THE ARTERIAL ROAD.
